page.title: 06Agriculture around Kilby
page.content: The grid is primarily agricultural in nature. Since the rapid spread of Enclosure in the late 18th and early 19th Centuries Leicestershire has been associated with stockbreading. This area of South Leicestershire is really no exception,the vast majority of land is given over to pasture or the production of hay or silage for winter feed. There is a limited production of grain but this is insignificant in comparison. The animals kept within this grid are mainly cattle and sheep. The cattle are kept both for dairy and meat production. There is a small area given to Markat Gardening but this is mainly for the farms themselves. Some land is also set aside for keeping horses the riding of which is a popular pastime in this area.
